name: Premier Inn Liverpool Albert Dock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend, i had never stayed in a Premier Inn before so i was a little cautious, my husband had stayed in this hotel and was very positive about it. I am so glad we didnt waste our money on a different hotel, we had 3 excellent night's sleep here, the staff were lovely and the location is excellent.
reviews.title: Best night's hotel sleep ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to be mindful that this is also a hen/stag type hotel but to be honest bar a little bit of noise on the saturday night it was very quiet. The rooms were very attrictive and spacious for what you pay, we didnt eat here so i cant comment on the quality of their food but my husband has had dinner here and was fairly happy.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really happy with our stay, very clean and the staff were very friendly. The meal deal was excellent. I have coaliac Disease and the hotel had data sheets to let me know what I could eat it was fab.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff and Great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Being from the states we had never stayed or heard of a Premier Inn and were kind of worried since the price was so cheap but it turned out to be a great place to stay! The location is amazing, right next to The Beatles story and the docks which has tons of shopping and eating. We were able to walk to the Cavern club and the little downtown area, it was about .5 mile. The building was very cool and our room was pretty big and very comfortable and clean. There are no real perks but thats probably why the price is so great. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful when we had questions about the area. When we go back to Liverpool we are staying here!!
reviews.title: Stunning location + unique building = more than your average Premier Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Premier Inn is normally a solid choice for a budget hotel. The Albert Dock Premier Inn can boast all the usual Premier Inn qualities - good value, decent service, comfortable rooms - along with a beautiful, historic building and great views over the Dock. My room (and presumably most rooms) featured exposed brickwork - a very nice touch. If you want to stay somewhere central in Liverpool and don't want to spend more than £100 a night, I really can't imagine you'd do better than this.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous! Couldn't ask for more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is defo the bestest Premier Inn i've stayed in, rooms are so unique.not like the bog standard rooms at most Premier inns. The bed & pillows were sooooo comfy. The room was a little cold on arrival but it was boxing day & had been snowing outside so once we got the heating on & the portable fan heater provided going it was soon roasty toasty.
reviews.title: Best Premier Inn I've stayed in :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The reason for our stay in Liverpool was the Cream Boxing Night Special so never got back 2 room until 4am so the only tiny grumble i have was we were woken up 9.30am as unfortunately our room window was above The Beatles museum were blaring Beatles music comes from the entrance once it opens :-( which is not good when you've not long got in2 bed.
reviews.title: Quirky hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Parking outside Hotel cost £15 for 24 hours which we paid b4 checking in2 room, once we had checked in we found out we could of got discounted parking in multi story carpark a 5 mins walk away. I was not 2 upset as it was freezing cold outside & don't think saving a few quid was worth the walk hahaha
reviews.title: Standards Sadly Slipping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will use this hotel again & defo recommend
reviews.title: What a craking hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night as we were seeing a show at the Echo Arena. The location was excellent - right opposite, with a selection of bars and restaurants nearby as well as a nice looking hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: If you think you know Premier Inn's think again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night in August. We paid £28 for the hotel room so shared between 2 it was a bargain price.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a trip to Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in a lovely location down on the Albert Docks - plenty of places to eat, drink & have a stroll around. It's about a 10min walk up to the centre of Liverpool.
reviews.title: Brilliant place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean, the room was fab. Paid for the buffet breakfast which was worth the money.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with a friend last weekend and we thought it was a lovely hotel. The staff were very friendly, as everyone seemed to be in Liverpool, the room was very clean, spacious and the food was good too.
reviews.title: A lovely loft room with beams and a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have asked for a better location either.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you're looking for a budget hotel in Liverpool, then look no further. Location and views are hard to beat. Close to all amenities. Lovely views over Albert Dock and the Liver Building. Spacious room and comfortable bed. Excellent breakfast and free for our teenager!
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I enjoyed my 3 nights at the Premier Inn @ Albert Dock for:
reviews.title: Nice Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - location right next to the Convention Center, next to the Beatles' museum
reviews.title: So noisy!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: - walking distance to huge, wonderful shopping center
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - many restaurants around (fantastic indian next door)
reviews.title: Best Hotel by far!

aka: Premier Inn Liverpool Albert Dock Hotel Liverpool
description: In the heart of Liverpool Albert Dock, this 19th Century, Grade 1 listed Premier Inn makes an ideal base to explore the local surroundings. Local attractions include ACC Liverpool Echo Arena, Liverpool One shopping centre, Tate Art Gallery and the Beatles Story. Conveniently located for Liverpool Lime Street Station. The hotel offers business & leisure travellers a great opportunity to stay in the very heart of Liverpool’s vibrant waterfront area.Our Liverpool Albert Dock Premier Inn has been sensitively converted to ensure none of the charm and character of the original structure was lost. The hotel offers everything you'd expect, incredibly comfy beds in every room and an integrated restaurant serving a mix of traditional and contemporary dishes.
